Description: Rim sherd of large Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below, with probable white line at lower break; exterior: three bands at rim separated by double dilute lines: diagonal strokes, stopt maeander and zigzag; below, painted decoration consisting of goat’s head ro right (part of neck, ear, eye, part of snout and horn overlapping rim pattern remaining); to right, part of goose’s neck and head, to right; pendant roundel as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, but dated later than those chalices because she considers the style of the drawing to be debased and because of the elementary and isolated interior decoration (Lemos 1991, 72-3).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 73, p. 235, no. 144, pl. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0194) (phase 2)
